ontology_schema.label: Legal Case
ontology_schema.description: The root node for all legal cases.

ontology_schema.label: Family Law Dispute
ontology_schema.description: Cases primarily governed by civil/family laws (e.g., HMA, Divorce, Maintenance).

ontology_schema.label: Maintenance Dispute
ontology_schema.description: Disputes related to financial support for spouse or children under various acts.

ontology_schema.label: Criminal Case
ontology_schema.description: Cases involving criminal offenses.

ontology_schema.label: Violent Offense
ontology_schema.description: Crimes involving physical violence or threat of violence against a person.

ontology_schema.label: Homicide
ontology_schema.description: Offenses resulting in the death of a person.

ontology_schema.label: Murder
ontology_schema.description: Offense of murder as defined by the Indian Penal Code.

ontology_schema.label: Sexual Offense
ontology_schema.description: Crimes of a sexual nature.

ontology_schema.label: Rape
ontology_schema.description: Offense of rape as defined by the Indian Penal Code.

ontology_schema.label: Gang Rape
ontology_schema.description: Offense of gang rape as defined by the Indian Penal Code.

ontology_schema.label: POCSO Offense
ontology_schema.description: Offenses under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act.

ontology_schema.label: Sexual Harassment
ontology_schema.description: Offense of sexual harassment as defined by the Indian Penal Code.

ontology_schema.label: Assault
ontology_schema.description: Offenses involving physical assault not necessarily resulting in death.

ontology_schema.label: Voluntarily Causing Hurt
ontology_schema.description: Offense of voluntarily causing simple hurt.

ontology_schema.label: Voluntarily Causing Hurt by Dangerous Weapon
ontology_schema.description: Offense of voluntarily causing hurt by means of a dangerous weapon or means.

ontology_schema.label: Attempt to Murder
ontology_schema.description: Offense of attempting to commit murder.

ontology_schema.label: Property Offense
ontology_schema.description: Crimes committed against property, such as theft, robbery, and trespass.

ontology_schema.label: Theft
ontology_schema.description: Offenses involving theft without immediate violence.

ontology_schema.label: Theft in Dwelling House
ontology_schema.description: Offense of theft committed in any building, tent, or vessel used as a human dwelling.

ontology_schema.label: Robbery
ontology_schema.description: Offenses involving theft with violence or threat of violence (less than 5 perpetrators).

ontology_schema.label: Robbery
ontology_schema.description: Offense of committing robbery.

ontology_schema.label: Voluntarily Causing Hurt in Robbery
ontology_schema.description: Offense of voluntarily causing hurt while committing or attempting to commit robbery.

ontology_schema.label: Robbery with Deadly Weapon
ontology_schema.description: Offense of robbery or dacoity, with an attempt to cause death or grievous hurt, using a deadly weapon.

ontology_schema.label: Dacoity
ontology_schema.description: Robbery committed by five or more persons.

ontology_schema.label: Dacoity
ontology_schema.description: Offense of committing dacoity.

ontology_schema.label: Criminal Trespass
ontology_schema.description: Unlawful entry into or upon property.

ontology_schema.label: House-trespass with Preparation
ontology_schema.description: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint.

ontology_schema.label: Lurking House-trespass by Night
ontology_schema.description: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night in order to commit offense punishable with imprisonment.

ontology_schema.label: Extortion
ontology_schema.description: Offense of extortion by putting a person in fear of injury.

ontology_schema.label: Mischief Causing Damage
ontology_schema.description: Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees or upwards.

ontology_schema.label: Preparatory Offense
ontology_schema.description: Crimes involving preparation or assembly to commit a more serious offense.

ontology_schema.label: Preparation for Dacoity
ontology_schema.description: Offense of making any preparation for committing dacoity.

ontology_schema.label: Assembling for purpose of Dacoity
ontology_schema.description: Offense of assembling with five or more persons for the purpose of committing dacoity.

ontology_schema.label: Matrimonial Offense
ontology_schema.description: Offenses arising from the marital relationship and related laws.

ontology_schema.label: Cruelty by Husband or Relatives
ontology_schema.description: Offense of cruelty by husband or relatives of husband.

ontology_schema.label: Domestic Violence (DV) Act
ontology_schema.description: Offenses and reliefs under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005.

ontology_schema.label: Other Offense
ontology_schema.description: Miscellaneous criminal offenses not classified under major heads.

ontology_schema.label: Causing Disappearance of Evidence
ontology_schema.description: Offense of causing disappearance of evidence of an offense committed, or giving false information to screen the offender.

ontology_schema.label: Criminal Intimidation
ontology_schema.description: Offense of criminal intimidation.

ontology_schema.label: Rioting
ontology_schema.description: Offense of committing rioting.

ontology_schema.label: Unlawful Assembly
ontology_schema.description: Offense where every member of an unlawful assembly is guilty of an offense committed in prosecution of a common object.

ontology_schema.label: Kidnapping or Abduction
ontology_schema.description: Offense of kidnapping or abduction.

ontology_schema.label: SC/ST Act Violation
ontology_schema.description: Offenses under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989.

ontology_schema.label: IT Act Violation
ontology_schema.description: Offenses under the Information Technology Act, 2000, usually related to publishing obscene material.

ontology_schema.label: Criminal Conspiracy
ontology_schema.description: Offense of criminal conspiracy to commit a crime.

ontology_schema.label: Terrorism Offense
ontology_schema.description: Offenses related to acts of terrorism.

ontology_schema.label: POTA Offense
ontology_schema.description: Offenses under the Prevention of Terrorism Act, 2002.

case_title.description: The title of the legal case (e.g., 'A vs. State').

judgment_date.description: The date the judgment was delivered.

court.description: The court that delivered the judgment (e.g., 'High Court of Delhi').

petitioner_identity.description: Name or identifier of the petitioner/applicant.

respondent_identity.description: Name or identifier of the respondent.

type_of_dispute.description: The specific nature of the family dispute.

interim_relief_granted.description: Details of any interim order granted (e.g., maintenance pendente lite).

statutory_act_used.description: The primary act under which the petition is filed (e.g., 'Hindu Marriage Act 1955').

claimant_identity.description: Name or identifier of the person claiming maintenance (e.g., 'wife').

respondent_identity.description: Name or identifier of the person against whom maintenance is claimed (e.g., 'husband').

act_under_which_claimed.description: The statutory provision under which the claim is made (e.g., 'HMA 24', 'CrPC 125').

maintenance_pendente_lite_amount.description: The amount of interim maintenance awarded (e.g., 'Rs. 5000 per month').

final_maintenance_amount.description: The final amount of maintenance awarded.

claimant_employment_status.description: Employment/income status of the claimant (e.g., 'unemployed', 'earning Rs. X').

respondent_income_source.description: Source and details of the respondent's income (e.g., 'salaried employee', 'business owner').

police_station.description: The police station where the FIR was registered.

ipc_sections_charged.description: List of the main IPC sections charged (e.g., '302, 34').

location_of_offense.description: The place where the criminal act took place.

motive.description: The alleged motive for the offense.

final_outcome_type.description: The final judicial outcome of the case.

probation_or_juvenile_status.description: Details regarding sentencing under the Probation of Offenders Act or Juvenile Justice Act (e.g., 'Released on Probation', 'Treated as Juvenile').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the deceased victim.

cause_of_death.description: Medical finding for cause of death (e.g., 'asphyxia due to strangulation', 'hemorrhagic shock').

weapon_used.description: The weapon or instrument used (e.g., 'knife', 'pistol', 'strangulation cord').

other_victims_injured.description: Names or identifiers of other victims injured during the same incident.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

victim_age.description: Age of the victim at the time of the offense.

act_description.description: Description of the sexual act committed.

medical_evidence_findings.description: Key findings from the medical examination of the victim (e.g., 'hymen intact', 'no injury').

use_of_force.description: Whether physical force or threat of harm was used.

location_of_offense.description: The place where the offense occurred (e.g., 'rooftop', 'accused's house').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

number_of_perpetrators.description: The number of individuals involved (must be 2 or more).

location_of_offense.description: The place where the offense occurred.

use_of_drugs_on_victim.description: Whether the victim was drugged or intoxicated.

motive.description: The alleged motive for the offense (e.g., 'communal hatred', 'extortion').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the child victim.

victim_age.description: Age of the child victim (must be under 18).

section_of_pocso_act.description: Specific section of POCSO Act invoked (e.g., 'Sec 4', 'Sec 6').

relationship_of_accused_to_child.description: Relationship of accused to the child (e.g., 'Father', 'Teacher', 'Neighbor').

nature_of_sexual_act.description: Description of the act (e.g., 'penetrative sexual assault', 'aggravated sexual assault').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

act_description.description: The specific unwelcome physical contact or sexual demand made (e.g., 'caught hold of hand', 'demanded sexual favor').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

injury_description.description: Description of the hurt or injury caused (e.g., bruises, swelling).

weapon_used.description: Weapon or means used to cause hurt (e.g., 'hands', 'fists', 'stick').

ipc_324.label: Voluntarily Causing Hurt by Dangerous Weapon

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

injury_description.description: Description of the hurt/injury (e.g., lacerated wound, fracture).

weapon_used.description: The dangerous weapon or means used.

medical_report_findings.description: Key findings from the medical examination.

motive.description: The alleged motive for the assault.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

injury_description.description: Description of the injury and the part of the body targeted.

weapon_used.description: The weapon or means used for the attempt.

medical_report_findings.description: Key findings from the medical examination of the victim.

motive.description: The alleged motive for the attempt.

location_of_dwelling.description: The address or description of the dwelling (house, tent, vessel) from which theft occurred.

stolen_property_description.description: List or description of the items stolen.

property_value.description: Estimated monetary value of the stolen property.

method_of_entry.description: How the accused entered the dwelling (e.g., 'breaking lock', 'open window').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim/person from whom property was taken.

stolen_property_description.description: List or description of the items stolen. Can be 'attempt' if nothing was taken.

number_of_perpetrators.description: The number of individuals involved (must be less than 5).

injury_description.description: Description of the hurt or injury caused (e.g., 'bleeding injury', 'contused lacerated wound').

weapon_used.description: Weapon used to cause the hurt.

medical_report_findings.description: Key findings from the medical examination of the victim (e.g., 'CLW on occipital').

identification_method.description: Method used to identify the accused.

property_recovered_or_not.description: Whether the stolen property was recovered from the accused.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim/person from whom property was taken.

stolen_property_description.description: List or description of the items stolen. Can be 'attempt' if nothing was taken.

injury_description.description: Description of the hurt or injury caused while committing the robbery.

weapon_used.description: Weapon used to cause the hurt.

number_of_perpetrators.description: The number of individuals involved (must be less than 5).

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

stolen_property_description.description: List or description of the items stolen. Can be 'attempt' if nothing was taken.

deadly_weapon_used.description: Description of the deadly weapon used or shown.

attempt_to_cause_death_or_gh.description: Whether there was an attempt to cause death or grievous hurt.

stolen_property_description.description: List or description of the items stolen.

number_of_perpetrators.description: The number of individuals involved (must be 5 or more, or charged with 4 in some cases).

weapon_used.description: Any weapon used or shown during the dacoity.

use_of_force_description.description: Description of the force or threat of force used (e.g., 'no one injured').

location_of_offense.description: The place where the dacoity occurred (e.g., 'victim's house').

property_recovered.description: Description of stolen property that was recovered.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the person against whom the offense was directed.

purpose_of_trespass.description: The intention behind the trespass (e.g., 'to cause hurt', 'to assault').

weapon_or_preparation_description.description: Description of the preparation made for causing hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint.

time_of_offense.description: A time indicating that the offense occurred by night.

offense_intended.description: The offense intended to be committed (e.g., 'theft', 'assault').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

threat_of_injury_description.description: Description of the threat or fear of injury used (e.g., 'make video viral', 'eliminate family').

property_extorted.description: The property or valuable security extorted (e.g., 'money', 'gold ornaments').

method_of_threat.description: How the threat was communicated (e.g., 'verbal', 'showing video').

property_damaged_description.description: Description of the property that was damaged (e.g., 'car window', 'house wall').

estimated_damage_amount.description: The estimated monetary value of the damage (must be 50 rupees or more).

method_of_mischief.description: How the damage was caused (e.g., 'throwing stones', 'using a stick').

act_of_preparation_description.description: Specific action taken as preparation for dacoity.

number_of_persons_assembled.description: Number of persons found making the preparation (>= 5 is Dacoity, < 5 is this section).

weapons_or_tools_gathered.description: Description of weapons, tools, or other materials gathered.

number_of_persons_assembled.description: Number of persons found assembled (must be 5 or more).

intention_to_commit_dacoity.description: Whether the common object of the assembly was to commit dacoity.

harassment_start_date.description: The date when the harassment/cruelty allegedly began.

shared_household_residence_details.description: Details of the shared household where the parties resided.

allegation_against_in_laws.description: Whether allegations are also against relatives of the husband (in-laws).

demand_for_dowry.description: Whether a demand for dowry is alleged.

wife_identity.description: Name or identifier of the wife/victim.

act_of_cruelty_description.description: Detailed description of the physical or mental cruelty inflicted.

perpetrator_identity.description: Identifier of the husband and/or his relatives accused.

domestic_violence_alleged.description: Whether the cruelty also constitutes domestic violence under the DV Act.

dowry_demand_details.description: Details of any property or valuable security demanded as dowry.

motive.description: The alleged motive for the cruelty (e.g., 'not bearing a male child', 'extorting money').

medical_evidence_findings.description: Key findings from any medical examination related to physical cruelty.

aggrieved_person_identity.description: Name or identifier of the person filing the application (usually the wife).

respondent_identity.description: Name or identifier of the person/s against whom the application is filed.

type_of_relief_sought.description: The specific relief/order requested under the DV Act.

shared_household_status.description: Whether the parties have or are residing in a 'shared household'.

protection_order_details.description: Specific details of any protection order issued.

monetary_relief_granted.description: Details and amount of monetary relief or interim maintenance granted.

custody_order_details.description: Details of any temporary custody order granted for a child.

harassment_description.description: Description of the domestic violence alleged (e.g., 'economic abuse', 'verbal abuse').

main_offense_committed.description: The main offense (e.g., 'murder') for which evidence was concealed.

act_of_concealment.description: The specific action taken to make the evidence disappear (e.g., 'hiding dead body in haystack', 'hiding body in bathroom', 'attempt to use septic tank').

evidence_concealed_description.description: Description of the evidence that was concealed (e.g., 'dead body').

perpetrator_identity.description: Identifier of the person who concealed the evidence.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

threat_description.description: The nature of the threat (e.g., 'death threat', 'threat to property').

threat_severity_category.description: Severity of the threat, mapping to IPC 506 (Part 1 or Part 2).

intimidation_method.description: Method of intimidation (e.g., 'verbal threat', 'showing weapon', 'text message').

location_of_offense.description: The place where the rioting occurred.

number_of_perpetrators.description: Number of persons in the assembly (>= 5).

use_of_force_or_violence.description: Whether force or violence was used by the assembly.

associated_offense.description: Other offenses committed during the riot (e.g., 'Murder', 'Gang Rape').

location_of_offense.description: The place where the assembly occurred.

number_of_perpetrators.description: Number of persons in the assembly (>= 5).

common_object_of_assembly.description: The object or purpose of the unlawful assembly.

associated_offense.description: The offense committed by a member in prosecution of the common object.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

victim_age.description: Age of the victim (relevant for kidnapping from lawful guardianship).

taken_from_lawful_guardianship.description: Whether the minor was taken from lawful guardianship.

purpose_of_kidnapping.description: The intended outcome or motive of the kidnapping (e.g., 'marriage', 'ransom').

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

act_of_atrocity_description.description: Specific act of atrocity committed (e.g., 'caste based verbal abuse in public view').

location_of_atrocity.description: The location where the atrocity occurred.

victim_identity.description: Name or identifier of the victim.

nature_of_obscene_material.description: Description of the material (e.g., 'sexually explicit video', 'obscene text').

mode_of_publication.description: The platform used to publish the material (e.g., 'social media', 'messaging app').

main_offense_conspired.description: The substantive offense that the conspirators agreed to commit (e.g., 'Murder', 'Robbery').

evidence_of_conspiracy.description: The overt act or circumstances proving the agreement/conspiracy.

number_of_conspirators.description: The number of individuals involved in the conspiracy.

act_description.description: The specific act constituting the terrorist offense (e.g., 'possession of unauthorized arms').

intent_or_knowledge.description: The intent or knowledge element required by the section (e.g., 'knowingly aided the terrorist').

material_or_device_used.description: Any weapon, explosive, or device used/possessed.
